DataElement.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale 8 Last 2 Weeks Have and Maintain an Erection Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation in the last two weeks describing their sexual function (problems with achieving/maintaining an erection), using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Past 2 Weeks Have and Maintain an Erection Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer._A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present._A question about an individual's ability to have and maintain an erection._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Concepts.definition: A 10-item self-report questionnaire that measures quality of life for men with prostate cancer.

Property.preferredName: Past 2 Weeks Have and Maintain an Erection Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.:A question about an individual's ability to have and maintain an erection.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 14 days before the present.
A question about an individual's ability to have and maintain an erection.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000

ValueDomain.preferredName: Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale Sexual Function 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual achieves/maintains full erections sufficient for intercourse.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual achieves/maintains full erections sufficient for intercourse.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Erections Sufficient for Intercourse, but Some Reduction in Firmness

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Erections Sufficient for Intercourse, but Some Reduction in Firmness
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual achieves/maintains erections sufficient for intercourse, but has some reduction in firmness.

Concepts.longName: Erections Sufficient for Intercourse, but Some Reduction in Firmness
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual achieves/maintains erections sufficient for intercourse, but has some reduction in firmness.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Erections Sufficient for Masturbation or Foreplay Only

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Erections Sufficient for Masturbation or Foreplay Only
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual achieves/maintains erections sufficient for masturbation or foreplay only.

Concepts.longName: Erections Sufficient for Masturbation or Foreplay Only
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual achieves/maintains erections sufficient for masturbation or foreplay only.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Erections, But Not Firm Enough for Any Sexual Activity

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Erections, But Not Firm Enough for Any Sexual Activity
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual achieves/maintains erections, but not firm enough for any sexual activity.

Concepts.longName: Erections, But Not Firm Enough for Any Sexual Activity
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual achieves/maintains erections, but not firm enough for any sexual activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual achieves no erections at all.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual achieves no erections at all.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Please choose the statement t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please choose the statement that comes closest to describing your sexual function in the last two weeks.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: PORPUS:Patient Oriented Prostate Utility Scale, Krahn M, Ritvo P, Irvine J, et al., J Clin Epidemiol 2000
